title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
OB: When I invoke the New Java Package option, a message appears at the top saying 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. However, at this point, my package name field is empty. I'm unsure what this message means. Is it an error? If so, should it be displayed in red with the error icon? There should be no error message when the package name field is empty and 'Finish' button should be disabled.
EB: When I invoke the New Java Package option and the package name field is empty, there should be no message displayed at the top. The 'Finish' button should be disabled in this case.
SR:
1. Open the New Java Package wizard.
2. Leave the package name field empty.
3. Observe the message at the top and check the state of the 'Finish' button.
